snippet.textDisplay: Childhood + Dragon Warrior I = my first brutally hard RPG experience. I havent looked back yet, this and FFI created the digital genre that we all love today.

snippet.textDisplay: To be honest, the first Dragon Warrior was the only Dragon Warrior I actually enjoyed. All the other ones just did not feel as good or epic for me. Maybe it was the solo atmosphere, the exploration feeling, the amazing and perfect music, but the others just didn't do it for me like this game did. I remember playing it and beating it when I was 4 on the NES, and spending hours upon hours grinding blue and red slimes to the left of Tantegel on those two little squares between the water because I was too scared to go north and deal with Wizards until I had a good full set of gear hahaha.
snippet.textOriginal: To be honest, the first Dragon Warrior was the only Dragon Warrior I actually enjoyed. All the other ones just did not feel as good or epic for me. Maybe it was the solo atmosphere, the exploration feeling, the amazing and perfect music, but the others just didn't do it for me like this game did. I remember playing it and beating it when I was 4 on the NES, and spending hours upon hours grinding blue and red slimes to the left of Tantegel on those two little squares between the water because I was too scared to go north and deal with Wizards until I had a good full set of gear hahaha.

snippet.textDisplay: Well, I suppose this means that we shouldn't be expecting to see anymore Dragon Quest series songs for a while. Ah, well. This is an excellent choice nonetheless. Here's hoping this series continues to be prosperous for years to come.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Dhoom Oh, I know he'll do more. I'm not worried about that. I was just hoping that we would save the DQ entry in his "Years" series for Best VGM 2009 for Dragon Quest IX.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Dhoom I was to referring to songs from the Dragon Quest series being included in SupraDarky's list of Best VGMs. He tends to spread out his representation of different series.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Dhoom Perhaps I wasn't semantically clear enough. I was not complaining, I was merely wishing that the Dragon Quest series *continues* to be prosperous, as in, it already is, and I don't want it to stop. This is not unlike how I would wish for a healthy person to *continue* being healthy.
snippet.textOriginal: @Dr. Dhoom Perhaps I wasn't semantically clear enough. I was not complaining, I was merely wishing that the Dragon Quest series *continues* to be prosperous, as in, it already is, and I don't want it to stop. This is not unlike how I would wish for a healthy person to *continue* being healthy.

snippet.textDisplay: @Dr. Dhoom Yes there is. Dragon Quest XI, I believe.
snippet.textOriginal: @Dr. Dhoom Yes there is. Dragon Quest XI, I believe.

snippet.textDisplay: This game changed and revitalized the RPG genre back then, and in the process the video game industry as a whole. It became the JRPG template. The game's success in Japan is actually what made Square greenlight Final Fantasy as they initially refused to give Sakaguchi permission to create it. I've already said many times how big a fan I am of this series, with its "comfort food" type of gameplay you always come to expect, so I'm quite excited for DQXI. I'm glad to see DQVII 3DS and Builders be nicely successful outside of Japan. It's also fun to remember that Chunsoft, and not Enix who was only the publisher, was behind the first 5 Dragon Quest games. Chunsoft went on the become the current Spike Chunsoft who is now mainly known for its great Zero Escape series.
snippet.textOriginal: This game changed and revitalized the RPG genre back then, and in the process the video game industry as a whole. It became the JRPG template. The game's success in Japan is actually what made Square greenlight Final Fantasy as they initially refused to give Sakaguchi permission to create it. I've already said many times how big a fan I am of this series, with its "comfort food" type of gameplay you always come to expect, so I'm quite excited for DQXI. I'm glad to see DQVII 3DS and Builders be nicely successful outside of Japan. It's also fun to remember that Chunsoft, and not Enix who was only the publisher, was behind the first 5 Dragon Quest games. Chunsoft went on the become the current Spike Chunsoft who is now mainly known for its great Zero Escape series.
